Ebbro 44251 Nissan Skyline GT-R (R33) 1998 Motegi GT Champion Race 4th Place É. Comas /M. Kageyama




1998 was the 4th - and final - season for the R33 GT-R in the JGTC series. The R33 took the GT500 Class title in its debut season in 1995 but was not able to secure a second title in 1996 or 1997 (sound like the R34 above?).

A lower center of gravity was achieved in the 1998 GT-R by positioning the engine downward and rearward. The engine was changed to a modified 1995-1996 Le Mans version with an additional 140cc of displacement. More popular with the drivers than the horsepower boost (now nearly 500hp) was the noticeable improvement of torque.

The #23 Pennzoil Nismo GT-R was driven by Érik Comas & Masami Kageyama. The season got off to a great start for them with wins in rounds 1 and 3. The car seen here is from the Motegi GT Champion Race - round 5 of the series - where Comas & Kageyama finished in 4th place. With top 10 finishes in all other rounds of the series, Comas & Kageyama secured the second - and final - GT500 class championship for the R33 in its last season of competition.
